Definitions: Traffic from third-party affiliates, promoting Samsung.com and its products (Tracking code: '_affiliate_')
Traffic from paid external campaigns that are not predefined in Samsung.com Data Governance
Traffic from an AI-powered campaign that runs across all Google or Bing Ads channels, separate from Paid Search (Tracking code: '_pmax_')
Traffic from a video-based Ad format delivered across online streaming platforms such as YouTube, Hulu, Disney+, and Netflix (Tracking code: '_olv_')
Traffic from a campaign type designed for visually engaging platforms to drive demand to Samsung.com (Tracking code: '_demgen_')
Traffic from paid keyword marketing, where users click search engine Ads to visit Samsung.com (Tracking code: '_search_')
Traffic from banner ads linking to Samsung.com (tracking code: '_display_')
Traffic from paid Ads on social media platforms (Tracking code: '_social_')
Traffic from users scanning QR codes placed on marketing materials (Tracking code: '_qrcode_')
Traffic from Samsungâ€™s official social media posts and content, distinct from paid social media campaigns  (tracking code: '_ow_' & 'social')
Traffic from users scanning QR codes embedded in Samsung-owned marketing assets  (Tracking code:  '_qrcode_')
Traffic from marketing emails sent to customers (Tracking code: '_email_')
[US Only] Traffic from Employee Purchase Program (EPP) marketing campaigns to Samsung.com
Traffic from links within Samsung-owned apps (e.g., Samsung Pay, SmartThings, Samsung Members) (Tracking code: '_app_')
Traffic from push notifications linking to Samsung.com. (Tracking code: '_push_' )
Traffic from text message campaigns directing users to Samsung.com (Tracking code: '_sms_')
[MobileApp only] Traffic from Samsung.com (web) leading to the Shop App (Tracking code: '_scom_')
Traffic from owned channel campaigns with a tracking code that are not predefined in Samsung.com Data Governance
Traffic reaching Samsung.com without a tracking code or referrer information
Traffic from organic search engine clicks that are not part of paid keyword marketing
Traffic where the referrer indicates an internal Samsung.com URL
Traffic from non-marketing sources entering Samsung.com without a tracking code. If a referrer exists, it comes from channels other than Natural Search or Social Network Referrals
Traffic from social media platforms linking to Samsung.com without a tracking code

Traffic from generative AI platforms directing users to Samsung.com. This includes AI-driven search engines and AI-generated content recommendations that result in website visits (Referrer contains 'chaptgpt.com', copilot.microsoft.com, etc.)
